content.description: Concert tickets went on sale at noon (t = 0) and were sold out within 9 hours. The number of people waiting in line to purchase tickets at time t is modeled by a twice-differentiable function L for 0 ≤ t ≤ 9. Values of L(t) at various times t are shown in the table above.
content.question: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 9, what is the fewest number of times at which L'(t) must equal 0? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: For 0 ≤ t ≤ 9, what is the fewest number of times at which L'(t) must equal 0? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
